entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued September 06 at 8:28AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...High Water on the Tanana River Continues This Week... The Tanana River continues to fall slowly this week. Rain over the next several days will cause water levels to fluctuate slightly, but the risk of flooding is over. People recreating or hunting on the Tanana River should be aware that many gravel bars will be covered with water, debris will be in the river, and there
entry.cap:areaDesc: Central Interior; Deltana and Tanana Flats; Middle Tanana Valley; Upper Tanana Valley and the Fortymile Country

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued September 06 at 8:28AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Snow Above 3000 Feet In The Alaska Range Through Tonight... The snow level is between 3000 and 4000 feet over the Alaska Range today, and will fall to 3000 feet tonight. Snow levels will stay low on Thursday, then start to rise on Friday. entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued September 05 at 10:55PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Snow Above 2000 Feet In The Eastern Brooks Range This Week... The snow level of 4000 feet will fall to 2000 ft by Wednesday night. The Eastern Brooks Range could get 2 to 4 inches of snow above 2000 ft Wednesday night into Thursday.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued September 05 at 10:47PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Rising Streams and Rivers Through Thursday... High water will occur on rivers and streams over the Seward Peninsula and in the Kobuk and and Noatak Valleys through Thursday. Heavy rain fell last night and today from Nome to Selawik, and heavy rain is expected tonight over the Kobuk and Noatak Valleys.
